humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " water " and "㕣", the original meaning is to go down the river. "Shu Wen": "From the water, 㕣 sound. "Chun Qiu Zhuan" said: Wang Yanxia." "Shu‧ Yu Gong": "Along the rivers and seas, reaching Huaisi." Kong Chuan: "Following the current is called along." The meaning of downstream can be generalized to mean following (water and other objects). Such as Jin Luji's "Wen Fu": "Or because the branches vibrate the leaves, or follow the waves to discuss the source." Another example is "Water Margin" Chapter 11: "Along the township, Daodian village."

" Along " can also mean following and inheriting. "The Book of Rites‧The Book of Music": "The love of rituals and music is the same, so the king of the Ming Dynasty used the same to follow."

" Yan " also means to follow. "Selected Works‧Jiang Yan"Miscellaneous Poems‧Important Yan Yannian "Serving Banquet"": "Testing the grace to be more than easy, along the distress and superficial." "Yan diao" means that officials are transferred according to the essay supplemented by the selection.

" Yan " in modern Chinese also means marginal. For example, "Journey to the West" Chapter 22: "I stopped Heyan and wouldn't let him go back."

humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「㕣」聲，本義為順流而下。《說文》：「緣水而下也。从水，㕣聲。《春秋傳》曰：王沿夏。」《書‧禹貢》：「沿于江海，達于淮泗。」孔傳：「順流而下曰沿。」由順流之義可泛化表示順著（水及其他物體）。如晉陸機〈文賦〉：「或因枝以振葉，或沿波而討源。」又如《水滸傳》第11回：「沿鄉歷邑，道店村坊。」

　　「沿」也可表示因循、承襲。《禮記‧樂記》：「禮樂之情同，故明王以相沿也。」

　　「沿」還表示跟隨。《文選‧江淹〈雜體詩‧效顏延年「侍宴」〉》：「測恩躋踰逸，沿牒懵浮淺。」「沿牒」意謂官員隨選補之文牒而調遷。

　　近現代漢語中「沿」還表示邊緣，如《西遊記》第22回：「我攔住河沿，不讓他回去。」
